text: Chibi Bana: "Itadakimasu! You pathetic little slug!"
You: "...Itadakimasu."
In the teachings of the Triple Fried Rice Faith, mornings start with 'Itadakimasu'.Itadakimasu means same to Let's eat in japan.
Chibi Bana: "You’re weak in the morning too... What *can* you beat?"
You: "It’s not like I’m physically weak… But still, 2 a.m. is way too early…"
Chibi Bana: "What are you talking about?! Fisherfolk usually get up around this time!"
Chibi Bana: "Same goes for bakers! Bread needs time to rise and ferment!"
You: "What are you even talking about?!"
Chibi Bana: "Anyway, let’s go."
You: "What about Tachibana? Not inviting her?"
Chibi Bana: "My sister can’t wake up in the morning… And she’s busy too. Let her rest."
You: "Got it."
Chibi Bana: "You're a beginner and it’s dangerous at night, so we’ll fish in a fenced-off spot this time."
Chibi Bana: "Make sure to manage your trash properly. If it blows into the sea, the fish will suffer."
Chibi Bana: "You brought your life jacket, right? The sea at night is no joke without one."
You: "Got it. Always assume danger before acting."
Chibi Bana: "Exactly. Understand nature, but never underestimate it. That’s how you stay alive. Preparation beats prayer. God won’t save your life, but a life jacket will."
A few minutes later
Chibi Bana: "Alright! Let’s bait the hooks! Good morning, my little worms!"
You: "Gyaaaah!"
You: "They’re way grosser than I imagined! Even if they’re cutely drawn!"
Chibi Bana: "Shut up! Do you even know what time it is?!"
You: "But… but… waaaah…"
Chibi Bana: "You’re pathetic… Look, just grab one already. You’ll get used to it. They’re kinda cute once you touch 'em."
Chibi Bana: "This is the face. The mouth. You place the hook right in front of that mouth. They’ll bite and swallow it, and the barb here will keep them on. That way the bait stays secure."
You: "...That's kinda brutal."
Chibi Bana: "That's how it goes. It's life and death, after all."
You: "Can't we just use lures or something?"

Chibi Bana: "Ah, lures are tough. I mean, they’re fake fish, right? But they don’t move on their own. So you have to use the rod and reel to make them *look* like they're swimming... and that’s really hard."

Chibi Bana: "Also, sometimes you can’t tell if your technique is off or if the fish around here just don’t like that kind of lure. Fish have preferences, y’know. Like, certain lures only work on certain species. Figuring that out is tough too."
Chibi Bana: "Well, I want you to catch something today. So just shut up and bait the hook."
You: "Nnyuuu..."
Chibi Bana: "Alright, I’ll do it for you this time. But little by little, you’ll get used to it. Eventually, you’ll do it yourself."
You: "Thanks."
A few minutes later
Chibi: "You said you’ve never been fishing before, but didn’t you try it as a kid?"
You: "Hmm, I did once. I only vaguely remember catching a pufferfish. I figured edible fish must be really hard to catch, and kinda lost interest after that."
Chibi: "Ah, I see… Honestly, cleaning and eating the fish is the main event. Like, you can’t enjoy pachinko in an arcade, right? It’s gotta involve real money to be fun."
You: (Is this kid really a little girl…?)
You: "Huh!?"
You: "Wait, did something just... bite?"
Chibi: "Ooh! Try reeling it in a little!"
You: "Whoa?! Something’s really there?!"
Chibi: "Heck yeah! Just keep reeling it in! Don’t stop!"
You: "UOOOORAAAAAARRRGHHHHH!!"
Chibi: "It’s a goby! Nice one! You can eat that!"
You: "Oh cool! How do you cook it?"
Chibi: "Tempura’s great! It tastes almost exactly like whiting!"
Chibi: "They’re super common in brackish water, but you can catch them in the sea too. Tasty little guys. Good job."
You: "What's brackish water?"
Chibi: "You know freshwater and seawater, right? So you’ve got freshwater zones, seawater zones—and in between, that’s brackish water."

Chibi: "Freshwater: 0–0.5‰ (rivers, lakes), Brackish: 0.5–17‰ (estuaries, tidal flats, bays where fresh and sea mix), Seawater: ~35‰ (open ocean), High-salinity: 40‰+ (like the Dead Sea). Basically, gobies like that gentle saltiness."
You: "Huh, can you eat those at restaurants? I don’t think I’ve ever seen them."
Chibi: "Sometimes you’ll see them in live tanks. But in my experience, they’re rare. Not the most appealing fish to most people. I like them, though."
You: "Oh! Another bite!"
Chibi: "Well well! Not bad at all! What did you get this time?"
You: "Is this a whiting?!"
Chibi: "Yep! It’s also known as the 'Queen of the Shore'!"
You: "That's so cool..."
Chibi: "Nice catch! That’s plenty already. And good size, too!"
You: "Way healthier than pachinko. Cheaper, safer. This is a great hobby."
Chibi: "Yeah. Of course pachinko has its fun too, but if you wanna quit gambling, maybe try fishing instead?"
Chibi: "I know this guy—'Squid Geezer'—he's basically a squid-fishing monster. When the season hits, he’ll fish for hours and line up the catch neatly in his fridge."
Chibi: "It’s like he’s honoring the dead. Total yokai. But he’s not hurting anyone, it’s free, and it builds skill. Solid hobby, really."
Chibi: "That said, if you enjoy pachinko in moderation, that’s fine too. GARO is badass."
You: "Wait… Have you actually played pachinko...?"
Chibi: "Of course not! I'm underage!"
You: "Then how do you know so much about it?!"
Chibi: "Anyway, good job! Let’s keep going ‘til we catch just the right amount!"
You: "Huh… but senpai…? You haven’t caught anything… have you?"
Chibi: "Wow. You’re really going there? Taking the chance to flex when you can? So lame."
You: "Wait—after acting all high and mighty?! Dropping all that fishing knowledge?! You haven’t caught a single fish?! Isn’t that kinda messed up?!"
Chibi: "Oh you little—! Acting all smug now, huh?! Alright then! It’s a battle! But not by number—we’ll settle this by total weight! And if I win, I’m throwing you into the ocean as fish food!"
You: "No way I’m agreeing to that bet! That’s terrifying!"
A few minutes later...
Chibi: "Nothing's biting!"
You: "I caught one!"
Chibi: "What is this beginner’s luck?! What did I even do wrong?! Hey! God! Come out here! Let’s duel!"
You: "Stop! That’s not just blasphemy, that’s straight-up dangerous talk!"
You: "Man, I gotta say..."
Chibi: "What’s with that look?"
You: "Guess knowledge alone doesn’t cut it, huh... It's only real if it’s backed by skill."
You: "Just like those old dudes in izakayas criticizing pro baseball players’ form..."
Old Guy: "Yeah, with a form like that, this year’s a bust again! Needs more hip rotation, like this—"
You: "Like, come on man, you try doing it yourself."
You: "That’s exactly how I feel right now."
Chibi: "Gaaaaaaah!! I’ll sink you! Right now! Straight to hell with the gods!"
You: "I’m against violence! Calm down! Also, watch your language!"
Chibi: "Damn it… At this rate I just look like a complete fool… Wait a sec…"
Chibi: "This one's huge!!"
You: "What kind of plot twist is this?!"
Chibi: "This might not even be a sea bass... My rod can't handle it!"
You: "It’s that big?!"
Chibi: "Yeah… This is bad… But I have to remember Santiago…"
Chibi: "You! Get the net! (like a bug-catching net)"
You: "Got it! I’ve got the net! What now?!"
Chibi: "I’ll bring it in close! Wait for my signal! Then use the net! It’s a foldable net—don't pull it out! Fold it first!"
You: "Understood!"
Chibi: "Alright! It’s close! Extend the net!"
You: "Okay! ...Wait, what?!"
Chibi: "No way! It’s a swordfish! Why is this here?!"
You: "This thing’s heavy as hell! I can’t fold the net!"
Chibi: "Damn it! Then there’s only one option!"
Chibi: "HURRRAAAHHHH!!"
You: "Whaaaaat?!"
Chibi: "I did it! My first swordfish!"
You: "That’s insane… Why was that even here…?"
Chibi: "No idea… But it's super heavy… Is this what it feels like? Santiago caught an even bigger one… I still have a long way to go..."
You: "No, this is amazing already! And we didn’t even need the net after all!"
Chibi: "True… But this puts me over your total weight. I win."
You: "...You’re right."
Chibi: "That means, legally, I can now sink you into the sea…"
You: "That’s not how the law works! Please stop! Mercy!"
Chibi: "...Fine. I’m in a good mood. But as punishment for disrespecting me—you’re helping clean up."
You: "That's it? That’s all I gotta do?"
Chibi: "Of course! It's best to end fun times on a high note. Now get moving. And rinse any dirty spots with that bucket."
Chibi: "Alright! Let’s head back!"
You: "Carry it?"
Chibi: "Of course! Carry it! You did gut them, right?!"
You: "By the way… who’s gonna clean the fish?"
Chibi: "My sister’ll handle it. Though… I’m not sure she can deal with a swordfish…"
You: "True… I don’t think even YouTube has tutorials on filleting one of those…"
Chibi: "Found one."
You: "There are videos?!"
Chibi: "Tons of them."
You: "You're right… This is super helpful!"
Chibi: "Alright! With this, my sister can totally handle it!"
Chibi: "We're home!"
Tachibana: "Welcome back! Whoa—what is this?!"
Chibi: "Amazing, right?! It’s a swordfish! A small one, but I reeled it in myself!"
Tachibana: "How do you even catch one of these?! Trolling? From a boat?"
Chibi Bana: "Nope! Off the breakwater! With worms!"
Tachibana: "That’s even possible?!"
Chibi Bana: "I know, right? Praise me, praise me!"
Tachibana: "Wow, amazing! So proud of you!"
Chibi: "And the goby and whiting? This guy caught them! Pretty good instincts, actually!"
Chibi: "You didn’t lose a single one, right?! That’s secretly super impressive."
You: (Is this heaven...? Maybe I did something good in my past life...)
Tachibana: "Awesome! Then today we’re having swordfish fried rice! And whiting fried rice! Goby fried rice!"
You: "Can’t we do a different dish for once?! Just for today?!"
Tachibana: "Hmm, true… Let’s make tempura with the goby and whiting… but how do we even fillet a swordfish…?"
Chibi: "What about Mr. Yamamoto with almost no teeth? He might be able to!"
Tachibana: "He hurt his back recently… No way he can handle a swordfish now. But I’ll bring him a share later."
You: "By the way, I found a video."
Tachibana: "Let me see… Huh, looks doable. Super clear instructions."
Tachibana: "Alright! Leave it to me!"
Tachibana: "Let’s do this!"
You: "That’s how you hold a knife?!"
Tachibana: "Of course. I can’t put power into it otherwise..."
You: "Huh… Actually, that kind of makes sense."
Tachibana: "You two must be tired. I’ll cook, so just relax."
Tachibana: "It’s done!"
You: "It’s fried rice again?!"
Tachibana: "This one’s different! Even goes well with sashimi!"
Chibi: "As expected of big sis! And you even cleaned the swordfish perfectly… Just from the video?!"
Tachibana: "Yep! It was super clear. When the textbook’s good, the answers come easy—it really makes you realize that."
Tachibana: "I tempura-fried the goby and whiting you caught too… Perfect size! And no swallowed hooks either. You've got talent!"
Chibi: "Nice one! Honestly, it’s common to catch nothing your first time. You nailed it!"
You: "Ugh…"
You: (Maybe I really died once… Saved a cat or something in my past life and earned some karma… Maybe that’s why I’m in heaven now...)
Chibi: "Why do you look like you’re about to cry? You’ve got this delicious meal right in front of you, what’s there to cry about?"
Tachibana: "...Did you really hate fried rice that much…? But in the Triple Fried Rice Faith, missing your daily fried rice comes with a death penalty… So… don’t cry…"
You: "It’s not that! And wait—there’s a penalty like that?! That cult needs a rework!"
Chibi: "When you feel like crying, eat something warm, take a bath, and rest. That means your heart’s tired. It’s also probably the melatonin."
Tachibana: "If you're crying, that means your body’s working. If you can cry, you can feel joy. And if you can feel joy, you can find happiness. You’re built for happiness, too."
Chibi: "Big sis really knows how to say the right stuff!"
You: "Thank you… really… both of you…"
Chibi: "Though if you flip that around, it means I *can* absolutely destroy you when I’m mad. So watch your mouth next time. If you flex again, be ready for consequences."
You: "...Way to ruin the moment… but okay…"
Tachibana: "Alright everyone! Dig in! You two caught these fish, after all!"
